1.q_string:
Two insulating plates are both uniformly charged in such a way that the potential difference between them is \(V_{2}-V_{1}=20 \mathrm{~V}\). (i.e., plate 2 is at a higher potential). The plates are separated by \(\mathrm{d}=0.1 \mathrm{~m}\) and can be treated as infinitely large. An electron is released from rest on the inner surface of plate \(1\).What is its speed when it hits plate \(2 ?\)

\(\left(\mathrm{e}=1.6 \times 10^{-19} \mathrm{C}, \mathrm{m}_{\mathrm{e}}=9.11 \times 10^{-31} \mathrm{~kg}\right)\)
The work done in carrying a charge \(q\) once round a circle of radius \(r\) with a charge \(Q\) at the centre is :
If \(C_{1}=3 \mathrm{pF}\) and \(\mathrm{C}_{2}=2 \mathrm{pF}\), calculate the equivalent capacitance of the network shown in the figure between points \(\mathrm{A}\) and \(\mathrm{B}\)?

Two identical capacitors, having plate separation d0, are connected parallel to each other across a point 'A' as shown in the figure. Charge Q is imparted to the system by connecting a battery across the points 'A' and 'B', and then the battery is removed. If the first plate of the first capacitor and the second plate of the second capacitor started moving with constant velocity u0 towards the left, then find the magnitude of current flowing in the loop.
Figure shows four plates each of area S separated from one another by a distance d. What is the capacitance between P and Q?

The electric potential \((\mathrm{V})\) in volts varies with \(\mathrm{x}\) (in meter) according to the relation \(V=5+4 x^{2}\). The force experienced by a negative charge of \(2 \mu \mathrm{C}\) located at \(x=0.5 \mathrm{~m}\) is:

A fully charged capacitor has a capacitance ' \(\mathrm{C}\) '. It is discharged through a small coil of resistance wire embedded in a thermally insulated block of specific heat capacity' \(s^{\prime}\) and mass ' \(m\) '. If the temperature of the block is raised ' \(\Delta \mathrm{T}\), the potential difference ' \(\mathrm{V}\) ' across the capacitance is:

A capacitor of capacitance \(\mathrm{C}_{1}=1 \mu \mathrm{F}\) charged upto a voltage \(\mathrm{V}=110 \mathrm{~V}\) is connected in parallel to the terminals of a circuit consisting of two uncharged capacitors connected in series and possessing capacitances \(\mathrm{C}_{2}=2 \mu \mathrm{F}\) and \(\mathrm{C}_{3}=3 \mu \mathrm{F}\). Then, the amount of charge that will flow through the connecting wires is :
Capacity of an isolated sphere is increased n times when it is enclosed by an earthed concentric sphere. The ratio of their radii is:

A combination of parallel plate capacitors is maintained at a certain potential difference. When a 3mm thick slab is introduced between all the plates, in order to maintain the same potential difference, the distance between the plates is increased by 2.4mm. Find the dielectric constant of the slab.

A parallel plate capacitor of capacitance 5μF and plate separation 6 cm is connected to a 1 V battery and charged. A dielectric of dielectric constant 4 and thickness 4 cm is introduced between the plates of the capacitor. The additional charge that flows into the capacitor from the battery is:

A body of capacity \(4 \mu \mathrm{F}\) is charged to \(80 \mathrm{~V}\) and an other body of capacity \(6 \mu \mathrm{F}\) is charged to \(30 \mathrm{~V}\). When they are connected the energy lost by \(4 \mu \mathrm{F}\) capacitor is:
In charging by Induction:
q_option: a metallic object is charged by bringing a charged object near it
a metallic object is charged by rubbing it with fur
a metallic object by touching touching with a charged object
a metallic object is charged by rubbing it with silk

1.q_string: Force between two charges \(\mathrm{q}_{1}\) and \(\mathrm{q}_{2}\) separated by a distance \(\mathrm{r}\) is proportional to \(\frac{\mathrm{q}_{1} \mathrm{q}_{2}}{\mathrm{r}^{2}}\). Proportionality constant is:
The unit of charge is:
The electric force on a unit positive charge at a given point in a system of charges is called_________at that point.
The energy stored in a parallel plate capacitor is \(\mathrm{E}\) and the potential difference between the plates is \(\mathrm{V}\), then the \(\mathrm{E}\) is related to \(\mathrm{V}\) as:
A \(600 \mathrm{pF}\) capacitor is charged by \(100 \mathrm{~V}\) battery, then the electrostatic energy stored in the capacitor is:

The radius of the circular plates of a parallel plate capacitor is \(8 \mathrm{~cm}\) and the distance between the plates is 4 mm. When it is charged with a battery of 100 volts, the energy stored in the capacitor will be:
If the distance between the plates of a parallel plate capacitor is increased by maintain the constant charge on the capacitor, then the energy density between the plates:
